User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X 10_4_11; de-de) AppleWebKit/533.16 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/4.1 Safari/533.16
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X 10.4; de; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13

Our Mac OS CTI client application "direct" comes with a Mac OS X service, that allows users to make a selection (typically a phone number) and use the service to let the application "direct" dial that number. That works fine for example in Mail.app, Safari.app etc. In Firefox it only works as desired when using the Menu (Firefox -> Services -> direct -> Call selected number). When using the keybord shortcut of that service. The service sometimes, gets called twice. Often the second time, the service is called by the user using the shortcut.

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
The bug can be reproduced using Mail.app:
I created a keybord shortcut for the Mail.app service "Send selection" ->  cmd-F2 

1. Select text in a Firefox window
2. Call the Mail.app service using the shortcut (cmd-F2)
3.Mail brings up 2 send windows containing that text selection 

Repeat steps 1-3 until the service is called twice. I could reproduce the bug when I called that service using the shortcut right away.

However, the bug does not occur, when using the Menu (Firefox -> Services -> Mail -> ...)
Actual Results:  
The service gets called twice when using a keybord shortcut for it.

Expected Results:  
The service should only be called once.
